definition: to make sth up/also written 假托[jia3 tuo1]
to pretend/to use a pretext/to make sth up/to pass oneself off as sb else/to make use of
variant of 假[jia3]/to borrow
fake/false/artificial/to borrow/if/suppose
vacation
see 假掰[gei1 bai1]
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee

sentences.english: He wrote and published the essay under notable's name.
sentences.chinese: 他假托名人写文章发表。

sentences.english: He used his sore throat as a pretext for not going to shool.
sentences.chinese: 他假托喉痛不到校上课。

definition: faking a modern object as an ancient one
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
prophecy/prophetic remark
secret language/codeword
divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
facing a wall, an imaginary construction (idiom); baseless fabrication
historical biography
falsification in writing/misrepresentation in written history/deliberate digression
Xu Zhonglin or Xu Zhonglin 許仲琳|许仲琳 (c. 1567-c. 1620), Ming novelist, to whom the fantasy novel Investure of the Gods 封神演義|封神演义 is attributed, together with Lu Xixing 陸西星|陆西星
variant of 敷衍/to elaborate (on a theme)/to expound (the meaning of the classics)
planchette writing/to do planchette writing
to demote/to denounce
Sima Chengzhen (655-735), Daoist priest in Tang dynasty
to seek/to search for
